docs.text: there seem to be two reactions to dark city .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you either love it or you are unimpressed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: count me as a " love it . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as good as the crow and spawn are , dark city is better .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: where the former two have a specific comic-book following , the latter is an original work with the potential for broader appeal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it has a similar look to the others , but dark city is much more thoughtful and much less violent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not clever or complex , the story is still fascinating , like a selection from the twilight zone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a man ( rufus sewell ) is awakened in his bathtub by a man with a syringe .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: surprised , the attacker runs off .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the dazed man gets out of the tub and finds a woman's body in the room .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a mysterious caller warns him to leave the apartment immediately , so he packs some clothes and leaves , never sure why he's leaving or what he's fleeing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghoulish figures in long coats recognize the man and chase him through the dark city , hounding him like figures in a nightmare .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: an odd blast of willpower allows the man to dream himself free from his pursuers long enough to check his i . d .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the amnesiac learns that he is not dreaming and that his name is john murdoch .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now if only he could remember the rest of his life . . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dark city is good on many levels .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: first , the look of the movie is excellent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: give credit to production designers george liddle and patrick tatopolous for creating a coherent look from diverse elements .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are visual elements from the american 1920s-60s , mixed with dickens-era urban industrial elements .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is all pulled together in a sad , dark look reminiscent of the diner in edward hopper's painting , nighthawks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: proyas' use of models gives an appropriately eerie unreality to the film's world ( for not only does the audience see the city a model , but so do the ghouls ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the look is like a cross between tim burton's batman and the bleak animation of the brothers quay .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: second , the editing of the film is good .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the pacing is on track , and the plot is revealed , the " amnesia " explained , in satisfying increments .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , the stylized editing within each scene gives the movie a tense , caffeinated look .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: third , the special effects are well used .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they look good , but more importantly , the right effects are used for the right job .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one example stands out in my mind : the coated figures who haunt the city can attack telekinetically .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a simple ripple effect is used .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a more showy effect could have been chosen , but then it would have just been gratuitous .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: restraint was shown where necessary , letting the more critical effects look more impressive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: finally , like gattaca , dark city spends a just a little effort striving for mythical significance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unlike gattaca , the story is just open-ended and non-literal enough to be successful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: john murdoch's recovery from amnesia is tied to the passing of the night , and the hopeful coming of the dawn .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his struggle with amnesia is both figuratively and literally the struggle of all mankind ( at least in his world ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when we finally see the big picture of the movie's world , it is as mysterious as the iroquois image of the world being carried on the back of a giant turtle .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a few minor flaws keep me from giving this movie the same perfect score roger ebert gave , but i do strongly recommend it , for its look , its pace , its story , and its timelessness .
docs.label: positive
